content:
WindowsSecurityToken Class

In this Article

Represents a security token that is based on the identity of a Windows domain or user account.

Syntax

Declaration

public class WindowsSecurityToken : System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken, IDisposable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken
  • WindowsSecurityToken

Inherited Members

CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause<T>()
,
CreateKeyIdentifierClause<T>()
,
MatchesKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)
,
ResolveKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)
,
Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

Typically, application developers do not need to use the WindowsSecurityToken class, unless a Web service must gain access to details about the Windows domain or user account associated with the WindowsSecurityToken security token. To get the details of the Windows domain or user account, access the WindowsIdentity property.

Constructors summary

WindowsSecurityToken()

Initializes a new instance of the WindowsSecurityToken class.
WindowsSecurityToken(WindowsIdentity)

Initializes a new instance of the WindowsSecurityToken class using the Windows user.
WindowsSecurityToken(WindowsIdentity,String)

Initializes a new instance of the WindowsSecurityToken class using the Windows user.
WindowsSecurityToken(WindowsIdentity,String,String)

Creates a new instance of WindowsSecurityToken.

Properties summary

AuthenticationType

Gets the authentication type for the token.
Id

Gets the unique identifier for the security token.
SecurityKeys

Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
ValidFrom

Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
ValidTo

Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
WindowsIdentity

Gets the Windows user associated with this security token.

Methods summary

Dispose()

Releases all resources used by the WindowsSecurityToken.
Initialize(String,DateTime,DateTime,WindowsIdentity,Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the WindowsSecurityToken class using the specified unique identifier, Windows user, and the first and last instants in time when the security token is valid.
Initialize(String,String,DateTime,DateTime,WindowsIdentity,Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the WindowsSecurityToken class.
ThrowIfDisposed()

Throws an exception if the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose* method has been called for this instance.

Constructors

  • WindowsSecurityToken()

    Initializes a new instance of the WindowsSecurityToken class.

    protected WindowsSecurityToken ();

    Remarks

    This constructor does nothing, by default.

  • WindowsSecurityToken(WindowsIdentity)

    Initializes a new instance of the WindowsSecurityToken class using the Windows user.

    public WindowsSecurityToken (System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity windowsIdentity);

    Parameters

    • windowsIdentity
      WindowsIdentity

      A WindowsIdentity that represents a Windows user.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      windowsIdentity is null.

    Remarks

    This constructor creates a unique identifier for the WindowsSecurityToken security token and assigns that value to the Id property.

  • WindowsSecurityToken(WindowsIdentity,String)

    Initializes a new instance of the WindowsSecurityToken class using the Windows user.

    public WindowsSecurityToken (System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity windowsIdentity, string id);

    Parameters

    • windowsIdentity
      WindowsIdentity

      A WindowsIdentity that represents a Windows user.

    • id
      String

      A unique identifier for the security token.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      windowsIdentity is null.

      -or-

      id is null.

    Remarks

    This constructor calls the Initialize method to initialize the properties of this class.

  • WindowsSecurityToken(WindowsIdentity,String,String)

    Creates a new instance of WindowsSecurityToken.

    public WindowsSecurityToken (System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity windowsIdentity, string id, string authenticationType);

    Parameters

    • windowsIdentity
      WindowsIdentity

      A WindowsIdentity that represents a Windows user.

    • id
      String

      A unique identifier for the security token.

    • authenticationType
      String

      The authentication type for the security token.

Properties

  • AuthenticationType

    Gets the authentication type for the token.

    public string AuthenticationType { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns String.

  • Id

    Gets the unique identifier for the security token.

    public override string Id { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A unique identifier for the security token.

  • SecurityKeys

    Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.

    public override System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey> SecurityKeys { get; }

    Property Value

    • ReadOnlyCollection<SecurityKey>

      A stem.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1 of type SecurityKey that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.

    Remarks

    The SecurityKeys method returns an empty collection, by default.

  • ValidFrom

    Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.

    public override DateTime ValidFrom { get; }

    Property Value

    • DateTime

      A DateTime that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.

    Remarks

    The ValidFrom property is set to the instant in time when the WindowsSecurityToken class is created.

  • ValidTo

    Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

    public override DateTime ValidTo { get; }

    Property Value

    • DateTime

      A DateTime that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

    Remarks

    A WindowsSecurityToken security token is valid for 10 hours, by default. The ValidTo property is set to the instant in time when the WindowsSecurityToken class is created plus 10 hours.

  • WindowsIdentity

    Gets the Windows user associated with this security token.

    public virtual System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity WindowsIdentity { get; }

    Property Value

    • WindowsIdentity

      A WindowsIdentity that represents a Windows user.

Methods

  • Dispose()

    Releases all resources used by the WindowsSecurityToken.

    public virtual void Dispose ();

    Remarks

    Call the Dispose method when you are finished using the WindowsSecurityToken. The Dispose method leaves the WindowsSecurityToken in an unusable state. After calling the Dispose method, you must release all references to the WindowsSecurityToken so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the WindowsSecurityToken was occupying.

    Note

    Always call the Dispose method before you release your last reference to the WindowsSecurityToken. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the WindowsSecurityToken object's Finalize method.

  • Initialize(String,DateTime,DateTime,WindowsIdentity,Boolean)

    Initializes a new instance of the WindowsSecurityToken class using the specified unique identifier, Windows user, and the first and last instants in time when the security token is valid.

    protected void Initialize (string id, DateTime effectiveTime, DateTime expirationTime, System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity windowsIdentity, bool clone);

    Parameters

    • id
      String

      A unique identifier for the security token. Sets the value of the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Id* property.

    • effectiveTime
      DateTime

      A DateTime that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid. Set the value of the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.ValidFrom* property.

    • expirationTime
      DateTime

      A DateTime that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid. Sets the value of the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.ValidTo* property.

    • windowsIdentity
      WindowsIdentity

      A WindowsIdentity that represents a Windows user. Sets the value of the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.WindowsIdentity* property.

    • clone
      Boolean

      true to create a WindowsIdentity object that is identical to the windowsIdentity parameter and assign that to the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.WindowsIdentity* property; otherwise, assign the value of the windowsIdentity parameter to the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.WindowsIdentity* property.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      windowsIdentity is null.

      -or-

      id is null.

    Remarks

    The Initialize method is called by the constructors for the WindowsSecurityToken class.

  • Initialize(String,String,DateTime,DateTime,WindowsIdentity,Boolean)

    Initializes a new instance of the WindowsSecurityToken class.

    protected void Initialize (string id, string authenticationType, DateTime effectiveTime, DateTime expirationTime, System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity windowsIdentity, bool clone);

    Parameters

    • id
      String

      A unique identifier for the security token.

    • authenticationType
      String

      The authentication type for the security token.

    • effectiveTime
      DateTime

      A DateTime that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.

    • expirationTime
      DateTime

      A DateTime that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

    • windowsIdentity
      WindowsIdentity

      Represents a Windows user.

    • clone
      Boolean

      true to create a WindowsIdentity object that is identical to the windowsIdentity parameter and assign that to the WindowsIdentity property; otherwise, assign the value of the windowsIdentity parameter to the WindowsIdentity property.

  • ThrowIfDisposed()

    Throws an exception if the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose* method has been called for this instance.

    protected void ThrowIfDisposed ();

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose* method has been called for this instance.
